required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Research Abstract Usefulness in Clinical Decision-making
clinical_study.official_title: Family Nurse Practitioner Perception of Journal Abstract Usefulness in Clinical Decision-making: a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: To better understand the extent to which family nurse practitioners (FNPs) might use research abstracts in shaping their clinical decision-making under simulated conditions. A secondary point is to examine if and how FNPs might use full-text manuscripts (associated with the abstracts) if made available to them.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will recruit the approximate 25 - 1st year and 25 - 2nd year family nurse practitioner students of the Graduate School of Nursing. After being presented an overview of the study and informed consent document, those electing to participate will draw a sealed envelope indicating whether they are assigned to group A (intervention group) or group B (control group). The participant will proceed to the associated room, be provided a brief clinical case (appropriate to their training), an iPad device with pre-loaded EBN-Search engine, and a questionnaire. The EBN-Search engine for the intervention group will include 9 research abstracts associated to the case. The EBN-Search for the control group will include both the research abstracts and full-text versions of the manuscripts. The participants will be provided 20 minutes to complete the questionnaire using the information available to them. The questionnaire will require the participant to indicate treatment plan, respond to questions regarding the usefulness of research abstracts, questions regarding the usefulness of full-text (control group only) and recommendations on improving EBN-Search.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure of perception of abstract usefulness in clinical decision-making
primary_outcome.description: At conclusion of the simulated exercise subjects will complete a data collection instrument indicating their perception of abstract usefulness in their clinical decision-making.

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of full-text manuscripts when available in simulated clinical encounter
secondary_outcome.description: For those subjects with ready access to full-text manuscripts (n=25) during the simulated clinical encounter, we will measure how often they are accessed by the subjects.

arm_group.description: In the intervention arm research subjects will be provided access to EBN-Search (a fictitious search engine) with nine abstracts relating to the clinical case but no full-text manuscripts.
Research subjects will be exposed to 9 abstracts and corresponding full-text manuscripts related to the simulated clinical encounter.

intervention.description: Family nurse practitioner access to EBN-Search without availability of full-text manuscripts.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Matriculated family nurse practitioner graduate students of USUHS 2010/2011 academic year
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences
